TITLE: Super Bowl betting is expected to top $7.6 billion. Don't forget the taxman if you win
SUMMARY: No matter where you place your bet, the IRS expects you to come to clean at tax time if you win.

TITLE: How to rethink your budget to combat rising inflation
SUMMARY: As inflation continues to run hot, you may need to rethink your budget. Here are some tips.

TITLE: One of the nation’s largest 529 college savings plans slashes fees. Others may follow
SUMMARY: College savings plans often come with significant tax benefits, yet there may also be some costs. Here's what to know about 529 fees.

TITLE: Rents are up 30% and more in some cities. What to do if you're worried about a big hike
SUMMARY: Average monthly rents are up more than 14% from a year ago. As a result, many tenants might see a big jump at lease renewal time.

TITLE: This company found a cure for employee burnout: a four-day workweek
SUMMARY: The four-day workweek has been shown to boost employee morale without sacrificing productivity for online retailer Primary.

TITLE: How these couples overcame financial infidelity, money secrets in their relationships
SUMMARY: Nearly 60% of adults say the pandemic increased financial stress in their relationship. For some couples, that stress may lead to keeping "money secrets."

TITLE: There’s a way to fight rising inflation with your tax return. Here’s what to know
SUMMARY: You can fight inflation by purchasing up to $5,000 in paper I bonds with your tax refund. Here's what to know before signing up.

TITLE: Food prices are still rising. Here are 4 ways to slash your grocery bill
SUMMARY: Food prices are up more than 7% from last year, with items like eggs and fish rising even more steeply. These tips will help keep your grocery budget in check.

TITLE: 1 in 3 young adults will see an average $800 tax credit boost this year
SUMMARY: The American Rescue Plan enhanced the earned income tax credit for 2021, making it available for the first time to some young adults.

TITLE: Inflation eroded pay by 1.7% over the past year
SUMMARY: Workers have seen their hourly pay jump at about the fastest clip in 15 years. But high annual inflation has eaten into those raises.

TITLE: Inflation and high gas prices are contributing to 'a lot of financial anxiety,' survey finds
SUMMARY: Many Americans are worried about rising prices and paying bills, a survey from eMoney Advisor finds. The results show over a third are not investing at all.

TITLE: More Covid relief for small businesses? Struggling industries hope that’s the case
SUMMARY: The omicron surge hit industries that had already struggled through the pandemic. Now some, including gyms, hotels and restaurants, are pushing for more relief.

TITLE: 71% of clients report experiencing financial anxiety. Here's why financial planners could be missing the signs
SUMMARY: Even people who are financially secure could be plagued by worry that a financial disaster is around the corner.

TITLE: Retirees seeking income may want to consider closed-end funds
SUMMARY: Although these funds come with more risk than, say, U.S. Treasurys, they also can provide decent yields.

TITLE: This hidden muni bond tax may trigger higher Medicare premiums
SUMMARY: Tax-free muni bond interest may trigger a costly surprise for high-income retirees with Medicare premium hikes.

TITLE: These scams may cost you this tax season. Here's what to do if you are a victim
SUMMARY: The 2022 tax season is underway. IRS officials are warning of a likely increase in fraud that could lead to identity theft and stolen tax refunds.

TITLE: Looking for an outdoors vacation spot? Rockies, Blue Ridge Mountains make top 10 list of ranges worldwide
SUMMARY: The Rockies and Blue Ridge Mountains are two of the top 10 ranges worldwide for holidays as recently ranked by U.K. outdoor clothing and gear outfitter Blacks.

TITLE: There are key differences between tax credits and deductions. What to know before filing your return
SUMMARY: Tax credits and deductions both reduce liability, but these write-offs have key differences. Here’s what to know before filing your return.

TITLE: What it would take for the government to cancel federal student loans
SUMMARY: The White House is looking at actions it might be able to take to forgive student debt. Here's what the different moves would cost.

TITLE: Education Department says it won't seize child tax credit for past-due student loans
SUMMARY: Consumer advocates were worried the federal government would garnish tax refunds to satisfy some student-loan debts. The Education Department says it won't.

TITLE: Here's who can file taxes to the IRS for free this year
SUMMARY: An estimated 70% of Americans filing taxes, or 100 million people, can submit their returns for free through an IRS program.

TITLE: Why U.S. minority communities may turn to cryptocurrencies to pay their bills
SUMMARY: Cryptocurrency owners have a reputation for being white and male. However, research shows adoption among Hispanics is disproportionately high.

TITLE: Here’s how much you can make and still pay 0% in capital gains taxes
SUMMARY: Are you expecting a tax bill for selling stocks or crypto in 2021? You may qualify for the 0% capital gains rate, depending on your taxable income.

TITLE: What remote workers need to know about their 2021 taxes
SUMMARY: Depending on where you live, how long you worked elsewhere and, possibly, where your company is located, you may need to file more than one state tax return.

TITLE: How to answer the ‘virtual currency’ question on your tax return
SUMMARY: There's a question about cryptocurrency on the front page of your tax return. Here's how to answer it and what happens if you don't report taxable activity.

TITLE: College enrollment continues to slide as free tuition and loan forgiveness stall
SUMMARY: The number of undergraduates in college nationwide is now down 5.1% compared to two years ago — a loss of nearly 1 million students.

TITLE: Op-ed: Did you know inherited qualified retirement accounts must be liquidated in 10 years? If you didn’t, you are not alone
SUMMARY: A provision of the 2019 Secure Act could impact your retirement savings plans or strategies to transfer wealth to future generations.

TITLE: IRS to stop using facial recognition for identity verification
SUMMARY: The IRS will stop using a controversial third-party service for facial recognition to verify identity for online accounts.

TITLE: Labor Department tries to prevent states from clawing back unemployment benefits
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Labor issued guidance Monday to reduce the number of households asked to repay pandemic-era jobless benefits paid in error.

TITLE: It’s easy to mistakenly skip these forms when filing your tax return
SUMMARY: With mounting challenges at the IRS, it's more important than ever to file a complete and accurate tax return. Here are some of the most commonly missed forms.
